title.narrative: 1.1 NUTRITION

description.narrative: 1.1 National and district capacity is built to coordinate, implement, and monitor pro-nutrition evidence-based interventions, which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Young children, adolescents and women use improved and equitable high-impact Health, HIV, Nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services

Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.1 National and district capacity is built to coordinate, implement, and monitor pro-nutrition evidence-based interventions

description.narrative: National and district capacity was built in policy, planning, coordination, implementation, and monitoring of nutrition-specific and nutrition sensitive interventions. | Status:Met | As-of Date:01/10/2018
